com.rti.dds.example.file
Class FileSegmentSubscriber

java.lang.Object
  com.rti.dds.example.file.FileSegmentSubscriber
public class FileSegmentSubscriber
extends java.lang.Object

FileSegmentSubscriber establishes entities to receive and reconstruct FileSegments and write them to disk.

Two threads are created to do this. The first, in this class, reads messages via DDS and passes received FileSegments to a blocking queue. The second, FileReconstructor reads from the queue until a complete file has been received and writes it to disk.

readMessages

protected void readMessages()
This method gets messages from RTI DDS and pushes them over to the queue. It continuously loops, waiting until the DataReader has new samples available. We then read all of these samples, and push them to the FileReconstructor's queue.

printStatistics

private void printStatistics(long startTime,
                             long endTime,
                             FileSegment segment)
Print throughput stats for a received file.

Parameters:
startTime - time we received first segment
endTime - time we received last segment
segment - any segment from file in question. Used to get overall file information.
